---
title: "default.yaml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file defines a configuration for feature flags and segments in a feature flagging system. It includes multiple flags with various rules and segments, each with specific constraints and distributions for different user groups or scenarios.

## Code Structure
The file is structured into three main sections: namespace, flags, and segments. The flags section contains multiple feature flags, each with its own set of rules and variants. The segments section defines various user segments with specific constraints.

## Symbols

### Namespace
#### Description
Defines the default namespace for the feature flags.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Identifier for the namespace |
| name | string | Display name for the namespace |
| description | string | Brief description of the namespace |

### Flags
#### Description
A list of feature flags, each with its own configuration.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name for the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE, BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE) |
| description | string | Brief description of the flag's purpose |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is currently active |
| variants | array | List of possible variants for the flag |
| rules | array | Set of rules defining how the flag should be applied |

### Segments
#### Description
Defines user segments with specific constraints for targeting.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name for the segment |
| description | string | Brief description of the segment's purpose |
| constraints | array | List of constraints defining the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching to apply for constraints (e.g., ALL_MATCH_TYPE) |

## Internal Logic
The file defines 50 feature flags (flag_001 to flag_050) with similar structures, each having two variants and 50 segments with different distribution rules. There are also additional flags with specific purposes, such as boolean flags and flags with AND segment operators.

The segments are defined with constraints based on string comparisons, typically checking if a user is in a specific segment.

## Configuration
The file uses YAML format and follows a specific structure for defining feature flags and segments. It appears to be a configuration file for a feature flagging system, possibly used in a testing or integration environment due to its repetitive nature and extensive number of similar flags and segments.
